response.overview: Through a series of short documentaries, Bicontinentals tells the story of how science is produced at the Carlini Base in Antarctica, Argentina. During the summer season, dozens of research groups arrive at the base to carry out studies on the soil, water, animal and plant life, and the human impact on this particular ecosystem. The production of knowledge in Antarctica by Argentine scientists contributes to our country’s claim of sovereignty over this territory and to the fact that more Argentines can know what is there, as well as to international cooperation in research on climate change that affects the whole world.
